speaker: Forge Floor
lines: Sparks rise and vanish with opinions about gravity.
Tongs hold a billet like a throat holds a vow.
Bellows heave; the fire exhales and remembers summer.
A dog sleeps under the anvil because it knows when not to argue.
A bucket of quenchant smells like stories you don't tell at weddings.
A bar flexes on the horn and decides to be a blade instead.
The rhythm of the shop pulls your breath into time.
Someone writes in chalk on the floor: 'Hot means don't.'

choices.text: Try a practice heat under a watchful eye.
Step out back to the slag heap.
